verses.verse: (Judgment on Israel’s Enemies) An Oracle. The word of the LORD is against the land of Hadrach and will rest upon Damascus. For to the LORD belongs the capital (Heb eye) of Aram, (Cn: Heb of Adam (or of humankind)) as do all the tribes of Israel;
(Jer 49.23; Ezek 28.3-5, 12, 21) Hamath also, which borders on it, Tyre and Sidon, though they are very wise.
(2 Sam 24.7; 1 Kings 10.21, 27; Ezek 27.33) Tyre has built itself a rampart and heaped up silver like dust and gold like the dirt of the streets.
(Isa 23.1; Ezek 28.18) But now, the Lord will strip it of its possessions and hurl its wealth into the sea, and it shall be devoured by fire.
(Am 1.6-8) Ashkelon shall see it and be afraid; Gaza, too, and shall writhe in anguish; Ekron also, because its hopes are withered. The king shall perish from Gaza; Ashkelon shall be uninhabited;
(Am 1.8) a mongrel people shall settle in Ashdod, and I will make an end of the pride of Philistia.

(Ezek 25.15-17) I will take away its blood from its mouth and its abominations from between its teeth; it, too, shall be a remnant for our God; it shall be like a clan in Judah, and Ekron shall be like the Jebusites.
(Isa 52.1; 54.14; 60.18; Zech 2.5) Then I will encamp at my house as a guard, so that no one shall march to and fro; no oppressor shall again overrun them, for now I have seen with my own eyes.

(The Coming Ruler of God’s People) (Isa 9.6, 7; 43.3, 11; 57.15; Zeph 3.14, 15; Mt 21.5) Rejoice greatly, O daughter Zion! Shout aloud, O daughter Jerusalem! See, your king comes to you; triumphant and victorious is he, humble and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.

(Ps 72.8; Isa 57.19; 60.12; Hos 1.7; 2.18; Hag 2.22) He (Gk: Heb I) will cut off the chariot from Ephraim and the war horse from Jerusalem; and the battle bow shall be cut off, and he shall command peace to the nations; his dominion shall be from sea to sea and from the River to the ends of the earth.
(Ex 24.8; Isa 51.14; Heb 10.29) As for you also, because of the blood of my covenant with you, I will set your prisoners free from the waterless pit.
(Isa 61.7; Jer 16.19; 17.13) Return to your stronghold, O prisoners of hope; today I declare that I will restore to you double.

(Ps 45.3; Isa 49.2; Jer 51.20; Joel 3.6) For I have bent Judah as my bow; I have made Ephraim its arrow. (Meaning of Heb uncertain) I will arouse your sons, O Zion, against your sons, O Greece, and wield you like a warrior’s sword.

(Ps 18.14; Isa 21.1; 27.13; 31.5; 66.15) Then the LORD will appear over them, and his arrow go forth like lightning; the Lord GOD will sound the trumpet and march forth in the whirlwinds of the south.

(Ex 27.2; Job 41.28; Ps 78.65; Isa 37.35; Zech 12.6) The LORD of hosts will protect them, and they shall consume and conquer the slingers; (Cn: Heb the slingstones) they shall drink their blood (Gk: Heb they roared) like wine and be full like a bowl, drenched like the corners of the altar.
(Isa 62.3; Jer 31.10, 11) On that day the LORD their God will save them, for they are the flock of his people, for like the jewels of a crown they shall shine on his land.
(Jer 31.12, 14) For what goodness and beauty are his! Grain shall make the young men flourish, and new wine the young women.
